intro: Pentacalia danielis, commonly known as Daniel's pentacalia, is a flowering plant native to the island of Saint Helena in the South Atlantic Ocean. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, showing adaptability to harsh environmental conditions. Its flowers are small and yellow, often arranged in clusters, and it produces achenes as its fruit type. Due to its restricted distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
